page.title: 12RAGDALE AREA LANDSCAPE
page.content:
The countryside around the village of Ragdale is diverse. At the northern end the land is flat. There is a covered Reservoir close to the road leading into Ragdale which is maintained by the Soar Division of Severn Trent Water Authority. The ground falls sharply into Ragdale village and rises again on the other side. There are several streams traversing the area and each of these lies in a valley, so that the southern area is one of rolling countryside.
National Grid Electricity pylons cross the western half of the Ragdale area from north to south.
